definition: valley/trough (as opposed to peaks)/fig. low point/lowest ebb/nadir of one's fortunes
low/beneath/to lower (one's head)/to let droop/to hang down/to incline

sentences.english: As l struggled through the snowdrifts, l had just about reached the lowest Point in my life.
sentences.chinese: 處在人生低谷的我在暴風雪中艱難地行走着。

sentences.english: A serious low for Beckham was at the 1998 World Cup.
sentences.chinese: 貝克漢姆的最低谷是在1998年的世界盃。

sentences.english: When feeling is in lowermost cereal, be to want to abandon or continue hard?
sentences.chinese: 當感情處於最低谷時，是要放棄還是繼續努力？

sentences.english: You can understand why this stock has climbed off its lows.
sentences.chinese: 這下你明白爲什麼這隻股票能夠從低谷爬升上來了。

sentences.english: Oracle and Microsoft were both born in difficult economic times.
sentences.chinese: 甲骨文和微軟恰恰就是產生在經濟低谷期。

sentences.english: You may need to test recovery during both peak and non-peak times.
sentences.chinese: 另外，還需要在高峯時和低谷時測試災難恢復。

sentences.english: We have spent together, the lowest point of life.
sentences.chinese: 我們在一起度過了人生的最低谷。

sentences.english: Shao Bing's affection and career are immersed in trough in succession.
sentences.chinese: 邵兵的情感和事業紛紛陷入低谷。

sentences.english: And obviously those who invested when stocks were in the dumps made money.
sentences.chinese: 很明顯那些在股市處於低谷時投資的人賺了錢。

sentences.english: And that will mark the low for this cycle.
sentences.chinese: 那個時候才應該是這個週期的低谷。

sentences.english: The peaks of one's adolescent reading can prove troughs in late middle age.
sentences.chinese: 一個人青春期閱讀的高峯可以檢驗中年後的低谷。

sentences.english: July, 2011 will be low watermark for year-over-year price trends in housing.
sentences.chinese: 2011年7月將是住房價格同比趨勢最低谷的時期。

sentences.english: Life has its low points, and we just have to deal with it.
sentences.chinese: 人生總會有低谷，我們必須得闖過去。

sentences.english: Many petals fell to the earth, and with them, my heart fell too.
sentences.chinese: 許多花瓣掉落到地上，我的心也隨之跌入低谷。

sentences.english: We think broad-market earnings growth may have troughed, " it added."
sentences.chinese: 我認爲更大範圍的市場收入增長可能面臨低谷。

sentences.english: When life pushes you down, push back!
sentences.chinese: 如果生活把你推向低谷，你就反推回去。

definition: (of market prices etc) to rapidly fluctuate (idiom)/volatile/significant ups and downs/roller coaster
summit/apex/pinnacle (of one's career etc)/peak (of a civilization etc)
one stumble, unable to rise (idiom); a setback leading to total collapse/ruined at a stroke/unable to recover after a minor hitch
to move up and down/to undulate/ups and downs
bumpy (of a road)/rough (of life)/to be down on one's luck/to be full of frustrations and dashed hopes
setback/reverse/check/defeat/frustration/disappointment/to frustrate/to discourage/to set sb back/to blunt/to subdue
